title: Test if nvcc version matches CUDA library version
body_html:
If you set CUDA_HOME to be CUDA 9, but forget to update the nvcc that is in your PATH, you'll get some very strange compile errors:

In file included from /usr/local/cuda-9.0/include/common_functions.h:50:0,
                 from /usr/local/cuda-9.0/include/cuda_runtime.h:115,
                 from <command-line>:0:
/usr/local/cuda-9.0/include/crt/common_functions.h:64:0: warning: "__CUDACC_VER__" redefined [enabled by default]
 #define __CUDACC_VER__ "__CUDACC_VER__ is no longer supported.  Use __CUDACC_VER_MAJOR__, __CUDACC_VER_MINOR__, and __CUDACC_VER_BUILD__ instead."

...

src/all_gather.cu(27): error: expected a type specifier

src/all_gather.cu(27): error: expected a type specifier

src/all_gather.cu(27): error: attributes are not permitted in a function definition

src/all_gather.cu(27): error: unnamed prototyped parameters not allowed when body is present

src/all_gather.cu(27): error: expected a "{"

It would be nice of PyTorch could detect this situation and give a warning earlier about it.

...

It would be nice of PyTorch could detect this situation and give a warning earlier about it.
body:
If you set CUDA_HOME to be CUDA 9, but forget to update the `nvcc` that is in your PATH, you'll get some very strange compile errors:

```
In file included from /usr/local/cuda-9.0/include/common_functions.h:50:0,
                 from /usr/local/cuda-9.0/include/cuda_runtime.h:115,
                 from <command-line>:0:
/usr/local/cuda-9.0/include/crt/common_functions.h:64:0: warning: "__CUDACC_VER__" redefined [enabled by default]
 #define __CUDACC_VER__ "__CUDACC_VER__ is no longer supported.  Use __CUDACC_VER_MAJOR__, __CUDACC_VER_MINOR__, and __CUDACC_VER_BUILD__ instead."

...

src/all_gather.cu(27): error: expected a type specifier

src/all_gather.cu(27): error: expected a type specifier

src/all_gather.cu(27): error: attributes are not permitted in a function definition

src/all_gather.cu(27): error: unnamed prototyped parameters not allowed when body is present

src/all_gather.cu(27): error: expected a "{"
```

It would be nice of PyTorch could detect this situation and give a warning earlier about it.
